\subsection{sorts.indexsort module}
\label{\detokenize{sorts:module-sorts.indexsort}}\label{\detokenize{sorts:sorts-indexsort-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!sorts.indexsort@\spxentry{sorts.indexsort}}\index{sorts.indexsort@\spxentry{sorts.indexsort}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Sorts the data according to an index
\index{sorted\_index() (in module sorts.indexsort)@\spxentry{sorted\_index()}\spxextra{in module sorts.indexsort}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{sorts:sorts.indexsort.sorted_index}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sorts.indexsort.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{sorted\_index}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{data}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{index}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Sorts the data (ascending) according to index, i.e.
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
data{[}i{]}{[}index{]} \textgreater{} data{[}j{]}{[}index{]}, for all i \textgreater{} j
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
INPUT:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{to} \PYG{n}{sort}
\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{default} \PYG{n}{index}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
OUPUT:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{sorted} \PYG{n}{data}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Examples

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{data} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{a}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{b}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{8}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{c}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{]}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{sorted\PYGZus{}index}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{[(1, \PYGZsq{}a\PYGZsq{}, 6), (2, \PYGZsq{}b\PYGZsq{}, 8), (10, \PYGZsq{}c\PYGZsq{}, 1)]}

\subsection{sorts.sorting module}
\label{\detokenize{sorts:module-sorts.sorting}}\label{\detokenize{sorts:sorts-sorting-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!sorts.sorting@\spxentry{sorts.sorting}}\index{sorts.sorting@\spxentry{sorts.sorting}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Accelerated sorting and selection functions using Numba.
\index{heap\_sort() (in module sorts.sorting)@\spxentry{heap\_sort()}\spxextra{in module sorts.sorting}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{sorts:sorts.sorting.heap_sort}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sorts.sorting.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{heap\_sort}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{a}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns a sorted numpy array (ascending)

\sphinxAtStartPar
INPUT:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{:}     \PYG{n}{Numpy} \PYG{n}{array}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
OUTPUT:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{ak}\PYG{p}{:}    \PYG{n}{Sorted} \PYG{n}{Numpy} \PYG{n}{array}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Implements heap sort from Press et al., Numerical Recipes, 3rd Ed.,
Cambridge University Press, 2007.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{a} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{asarray}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{10.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{7.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{6.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{5.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{4.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{3.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{2.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{1.}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{all}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{heap\PYGZus{}sort}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{asarray}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{1.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{2.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{3.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{4.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{5.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{6.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{7.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{10.}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{True}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{selection() (in module sorts.sorting)@\spxentry{selection()}\spxextra{in module sorts.sorting}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{sorts:sorts.sorting.selection}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sorts.sorting.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{selection}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{a}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{K}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns the value and index of the \(K`th largest element in the numpy
array `a\).

\sphinxAtStartPar
INPUT:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{:}     \PYG{n}{Numpy} \PYG{n}{array}
\PYG{n}{K}\PYG{p}{:}     \PYG{n+nb}{int}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
OUTPUT:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{s}\PYG{p}{:}     \PYG{n}{The} \PYG{n}{Kth} \PYG{n}{largest} \PYG{n}{value} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{K} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{N}\PYG{p}{;} \PYG{n}{N} \PYG{n}{length} \PYG{n}{of} \PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{:}     \PYG{n}{Index} \PYG{n}{of} \PYG{n}{the} \PYG{n}{Kth} \PYG{n}{largest} \PYG{n}{value}\PYG{o}{.} \PYG{n}{If} \PYG{n}{the} \PYG{n}{index} \PYG{o+ow}{is} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n}{unique}
       \PYG{n}{returns} \PYG{n}{the} \PYG{n}{first} \PYG{n}{index} \PYG{n}{such} \PYG{n}{that} \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Implements selection from Press et al., Numerical Recipes, 3rd Ed.,
Cambridge University Press, 2007.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{a} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{asarray}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{10.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{7.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{6.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{5.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{4.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{3.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{2.}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{1.}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{g+go}{(10.0, 0)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{selection}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{(5.0, 3)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
